text: Malcolm Schofield, (born 19 April 1942) is a British classicist and academic, specialising in ancient philosophy. Having taught at Cornell University and the University of Oxford, he joined the University of Cambridge in 1972 as a lecturer in classics and a Fellow of St John's College, Cambridge. He was promoted to Reader in Ancient Philosophy in 1989, and made Professor of Ancient Philosophy 1998. Since retiring in 2009, he has been an Emeritus Professor at Cambridge. In 1997, Schofield was elected a Fellow of the British Academy (FBA), the United Kingdom's national academy for the humanities and social sciences. ==Selected works== * * * * * ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:British classical scholars Category:Scholars of ancient philosophy Category:Cornell University faculty Category:Classical scholars of the University of Oxford Category:Fellows of St John's College, Cambridge Category:Members of the University of Cambridge faculty of classics Category:Fellows of the British Academy
